title: Gallery Talk: Volta Photo
hero_caption: <p>Ibrahima Sanlé Sory.<em>&nbsp;</em><em>Double-exposure self-portrait in Place du Paysan Noir (Black Farmer Square)</em>, about 1970. Gift …
description:
Join educator Paulina Lopez for an overview of Volta Photo: Starring Sanlé Sory and the People of Bobo-Dioulasso in the Small but Musically Mighty Country of Burkina Faso, a special exhibition that brings together photography and popular music of the West African country to present an immersive experience of a young nation negotiating its local, regional, and international identities.

To request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program, please call (312) 443-3680 or send an e-mail to access@artic.edu as far in advance as possible.

Please see the museum’s Accessibility page for more information.
